title: Frissons is when you have chills from music or beauty.
excerpt: Blood & Zatorre (2001), neuroscience study on “aesthetic chills”

title: 17/144: Do you like to feel proud?
Sonder is a sudden realization that every person you pass has a life as vivid and complex as yours.
excerpt: This term was introduced in The Dictionary of Obscure Sorrows by John Koenig, describing the quiet shock of recognizing the depth in others’ lives.

title: There is an emotion where people literally turn into wild pigs.
excerpt: Overwhelmed individuals steal small things, hide in the forest, and come back calm, as if nothing happened (Averill, 1980).

title: Emotional experience is a function.
excerpt: It is a function of how we feel, how we wish to feel, how we try to feel, how we classify what we feel, and how we express it. The Psychology of Emotions - (Carroll E. Izard, 1991)

title: Naming emotions in the corporate workplace as a way to measure learnability.
excerpt: Non-judgemental measurement system for corporate settings.
